meanings.sent1: The teacher's constant use of prosaism made the students lose interest in the lesson.
meanings.sent2: His speech was filled with prosaism, lacking any originality or excitement.
meanings.sent3: The prosaism in her writing was so predictable that it put everyone to sleep.
meanings.sent4: The room was filled with the prosaism of everyday conversations, blending into a monotonous hum.
meanings.sent5: She tried to add color to her story, but the prosaism overshadowed any attempt at creativity.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being prosaic
meanings.sent1: The prosaism of the room made it feel like time was standing still.
meanings.sent2: His writing lacked any spark, showing a complete embrace of prosaism.
meanings.sent3: The prosaism of the situation was so overwhelming that it almost became comical.
meanings.sent4: The prosaism of the city streets mirrored the monotony of everyday life.
meanings.sent5: She couldn't stand the prosaism of the office environment, yearning for some excitement.
